author: Jim Fusilli
title: ‘Blood’ by Rhye Review: Soul-Pop That Hits All the High Notes
text:
On “Blood” (Loma Vista), its first new album since 2013, Rhye sweetens its sensual soul-pop with a more limber yet equally sophisticated blend of acoustic and electronic instruments, played under and around the seductive voice of Mike Milosh. Those who fell in love with Rhye’s debut album, “Woman”—which called to mind an updated take on the music of Sade—will be thoroughly gratified once again.
Arriving on Friday, “Blood” reveals that Mr. Milosh still revels in restraint, building meticulous tracks that continually add and...
